question:
The 1984 Mahishi Committee was making news frequently in recent times. Which of the following is / are correct observations regarding the same?
  1. The committee recommended 100% reservation for locals in Karnataka for all public sector jobs
  2. It recommended 80% reservation for locals in Karnataka in all private jobs
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
Groups in Karnataka state announced a bandh on February 13<sup>th</sup>, demanding reservation in jobs for the locals in accordance with the 1984 Mahishi Committee recommendations.
The Mahishi Committee was headed by former Union Minister Sarojini Bindurao Mahishi and was constituted in 1984. The February 13<sup>th</sup> bandh in the state used this report as the basis.
The Mahishi Committee recommended 100% reservation of group-C and group-D jobs for Kannadigas in all central public sector units and central government departments in the state. It also recommended reservation of 65% of the group-A jobs and 80% of the group-B jobs in the central PSUs and departments in the state.
The Mahishi Committee recommended reservation of jobs for Kannadigas in private sector and multinational companies in the state too. All jobs, except those requiring skill and seniority, are to be reserved for the local people. The committee recommended that industries in the state employ locals on a priority basis.
